🌎 Plastic pollution: The Great Pacific garbage patch aka GPGP, a new continent made of humanity’s plastic

Today’s pollution hotspot:

Anthropogenic pollutions have unknown consequences: the North Pacific Garbage Patch or Pacific trash vortex
Type: low density marine debris (plastic, microplastic, floating trash)
Where: North Pacific Ocean [135°W—155°W and 35°N—42°N]
Quantity (est.): 1.6 million square kilometres; 80,000 metric tons (source: NG)
Date reported: 23/11/2023
Cause: rivers, oceans littered with debris
Consequences: several garbage patches form in the oceans (Pacific, Atlantic) due to the North Pacific Subtropical Gyre
Risks: environment (marine wildlife); human health (through the food chain)
Status: no solution (only limit anthropogenic production of plastic)
Source: u/NationalGeographic National Geographic
Info: Wikipedia; The Ocean Cleanup
